lexUnit.name: permit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give permission to (someone) or for (something).

sentence.text: Similarly , not all authorities would permit nurses to use their Mental Health Act powers to detain patients .
The manager of a public house was permitted by the owners , E. Lacon & Co. , to take paying guests into the ` private " rooms of the manager 's living accommodation for his private profit .

China 's Gansu Institute for Natural Energy , the only institute permitted by Chinese authorities to design solar energy equipment , is establishing itself as a training centre for solar energy technicians from African countries .
The central government also permitted local authorities to provide extra services in addition to the ones covered by the basic charge .
The same difficulty may discourage a teacher from permitting the children to ask too many questions themselves .
The year was 1881 and the Maître Escoffier permitted me the honour of putting my name to the dish , civet de liévre á la façon Didier .
She was not going to permit any of the children to steal a part of her identity .
` Well , I do n't know , " said my mother , extremely dubiously , but she permitted herself to be led to a table and sat down .
A mutant who survived to become an adult was permitted to live , but he was forbidden to breed to produce more of his kind .
Nobody inside the movement was permitted to acquire enough power or a high enough profile to challenge de Gaulle successfully .
There may be a freedom to protest -- but it exists only to the extent that it is permitted by the police .
They were permitted by their superiors to take personal booty back with them .
He was permitted to take his family with him , but the only intellectual companionship he found was among the Catholic missionaries : the local inhabitants remained strangers to him .
Look , Preston , if I understand my client correctly , you are the man he permitted to visit with a Miss Fraser ? "
Many , indeed , had already been dispossessed , since emigrants from Germany were permitted to take with them no more than a nominal ten Reichsmarks .
But on an afternoon following one of the City excursions , Joan was at last permitted to see Prince Richard .
When elected councillors were given the chance to judge the film , 127 councils voted to approve its exhibition to adult audiences , whilst seven went so far as to permit entry to 14-year-olds .
Black psychiatric nurses and doctors are not permitted to care for white patients ( according to a 1984 study ) while there were no psychiatrists of ` African " descent in 1982 .
The Adjutant even permitted himself a rueful grin just as the office door itself opened and the CO strode in .
I will try either Lady Jones or Lord Darnford , if they 'll permit you to take refuge with them , for I never saw sweetness and innocence like yours .
